import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.ec5d4d15:

plt.xlabel("Years of Experience")
plt.ylabel("Salary")

source.18afd32c:
def linearreg(X,Y):
    n=len(X)
    mx=np.mean(X)
    my=np.mean(Y)
    SS_xx=0
    SS_xy=0
    for i in range(n):
        SS_xx=SS_xx+(X[i]-mx)**2
        SS_xy=SS_xy+(X[i]-mx)*(Y[i]-my)
    m=SS_xy/SS_xx
    c=my-m*mx
    return m,c
source.0043b6f6:
m,c=linearreg(X,Y)
print(m,c)
y_pred=(m*X+c)
plt.scatter(X,Y)
plt.xlabel("Years of Experience")
plt.ylabel("Salary")
plt.plot(X,y_pred,label="regression line",color="red")
plt.show()
source.65a07e88:
z = [i for i in range (1,len(Y)+1,1)]
plt.plot(z,Y,color='r',linestyle='-')
plt.plot(z,y_pred,color='g',linestyle='-')
plt.xlabel('Salary')
plt.ylabel('index')
plt.title('Comparison')
plt.show()

source.1a432c9d:
def gradientdescent(X,Y):
    m=0
    c=0
    n=float(len(X))
    L=.001   #Learning Rate
    epochs=1000
    for i in range(epochs):
        y_pred=m*X+c
        Dm=(-2/n)*(np.sum(X*(Y-y_pred)))
        Dc=(-2/n)*(np.sum(Y-y_pred))
        m=m-L*Dm
        c=c-L*Dc
        
    
        plt.plot(X,y_pred,label="regression line")
        
    return m,c
source.3470b31f:
plt.scatter(X,Y)
plt.xlabel("Years of Experience")
plt.ylabel("Salary")
gradientdescent(X,Y)
plt.show()
